title: The sad, sad tale of the Nintendo 64 emulator
comment: The way Nintendo 64 emulators are designed parallels how the Nintendo 64 itself was created... with total focus on Super Mario 64, at the expense of everything else.  MUPEN plays that game beautifully, but heaven help you if you try to step foot outside the Mushroom Kingdom!  Play WipeOut 64 and you'll notice half the graphics are missing.  Try Tom and Jerry: Fists of Furry and you won't get past the character select screen.  Fire up Sin and Punishment and your phone dies in a fiery crash after two minutes.  I haven't tried other games yet, but I expect more of the same, which seems to be the status quo for Nintendo 64 emulation.  MUPEN is worth the dollar for Super Mario 64 alone, but that's pretty much all you're going to get.
So far so great

title: Best Emulator Period
comment: I have pxse and it is good, but it doesn't have the touchpad joystick support. Also, I had the original  mupen64 before some jealous idiot ripped mupen64 off and filed a false google complaint to get mupen64 suspended from the store. Anywho, the original was great, this is even better and cheaper, and Don't you dare buy any other 64 emulator. Trust me, you'll thank me later. To the maker of this app, I support you. I didn't hesitate to buy this app twice, regardless of the situation. Glad to have it again.
